page.title: 16LAMB FARM
page.content: When we went to look at Lamb Farm we discovered that it did not have any sheep or lambs as the name suggested. Lamb Farm had got rid of all its livestock in 1978.Even by then the only animals there were cows and goats. Now the farm has four tractors, a combine harvester, a forklift truck and other farm machinery. The farm itself includes four tied cottages, none of which are lived in. The average pay of the farm workers is Â£82.00 if they are unqualified, but if qualified this goes up to Â£98.00. The working day begins at 7.45am. and finishes at 4.30pm. The farm is 350 acres in size and the land itself is worth Â£700,000. Crops grown include barley,for malting,wheat, sugar beet, potatoes, and peas. Lamb Farm is an arable farm.
